snippet: NATO was found to have insufficiently investigated air raids it conducted that killed at least 60 Libyan civilians.
abstract: United Nations releases report criticizing NATO's response to its air raids in Libya that killed and wounded civilians; also faults Libya's effort to curb violence; report paints a gloomy picture of the level of respect for human rights and international law in Libya, while acknowledging that the problem is legacy of long years of violent repression under Col Muammar el-Qaddafi.
lead_paragraph: NATO was found to have insufficiently investigated air raids it conducted that killed at least 60 Libyan civilians.

headline.main: U.N. Faults NATO and Libyan Authorities in Report
headline.print_headline: U.N. Report Faults NATO’s Response to Civilian Toll and Libya’s Failure to Curb Violence

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
